ground_truth: He picks up something silky and holds it out, smiling apologetically. He passes water to the men on the truck's roof. Holding his dog, he looks at Sarah. She looks out of the passenger window. A kangaroo paw and a dribble of blood run down the windscreen. She peers in horror through her desert glasses, her net veil blowing in the breeze. The hunters lounge happily on top of the truck, which heads out across the flat, sandy desert. They drive along the top of a weir, across a wide river. At night, they camp around a fire. Drover is washing his muscled torso, using water from a bucket. Sarah pops her head out of her tent, staring as the water pours off his rippling muscles. They mime keeping each other warm, and she ducks back into her tent. He walks towards her with a raised eyebrow. He pulls down the waistband of his trousers suggestively. Camels pull a truck with no engine, watched by Goolaj and Magarri. A man falls off the vehicle. He lies in a heap in the dust. Later, he's in the truck next to the horrified Sarah. Drover nods. They drive on across a flat, dusty plain. They're bumping slowly along a rocky track. A girl runs up to them. The boy gallops on the horse, through the sparse trees. The boy arrives at Faraway Downs and reins in the horse, looking out at the approaching truck. The boy runs through the gate to the house and leaps over a fence. They just miss the horse, which rears up. Thick smoke obscures the house. As he loads, the boy climbs into the water tower. Drover walks through the smoke. The boy drops down inside the tower. Sarah sits uncomfortably next to the drunk Kipling. The smoke clears, revealing a large house. Kipling collapses. Drover, shrouded in smoke, walks past a dead cow. Sarah, jaw set, gets out of the truck. She stomps furiously towards the house, as Drover approaches a blazing funeral fire. He examines it thoughtfully and looks around. The boy stretches out his hands. An aboriginal is sitting on the ground. As she enters the house, women hold out buckets of smoking leaves. The boy poses mystically. Sarah strides past members of the household and sees her husband, dead on a table. She reels in shock. He's got a wound in the middle of his chest. His eyes stare glassily. She stares at the Chinese man and reaches out to close Maitland's eyes, but a man's hand does it for her. She eyes the man, her hand poised near Maitland's face. Members of staff hover in the corners of the room. The house is shrouded in a cloud of dust and smoke, a big blaze but tiny in the vast landscape.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat picks up something furry and holds it out, grinning sheepishly. The cat passes juice to the squirrels on the ship's mast. Holding his parrot, the cat looks at Lucy. Lucy gazes out of the driver window. A fox tail and a splash of paint slide down the windshield. Lucy peers in amusement through her ocean goggles, her silk scarf fluttering in the gust. The gardeners lounge lazily on top of the ship, which sails out across the wide, green ocean. They glide along the top of a dam, across a narrow bridge. At dawn, they nap around a lantern. Carpenter is scrubbing his tattooed legs, using milk from a pitcher. Lucy pops her head out of her cabin, gawking as the milk dribbles off his gleaming tattoos. They mimic keeping each other cozy, and she ducks back into her cabin. The cat strolls towards her with a curious smile. The cat pulls up the brim of his hat teasingly. Elephants tug a canoe with no paddles, watched by Kookaburra and Koala. A woman tumbles off the machine. She lands in a heap in the gravel. Eventually, she's in the canoe next to the startled Lucy. Carpenter winks. They sail on across a narrow, grassy valley. They're gliding smoothly along a sandy path. A dolphin swims up to them. The monkey dashes on the ostrich, through the dense bushes. The monkey arrives at Distant Plains and reigns in the ostrich, peering out at the rolling canoe. The monkey dashes through the gate to the barn and vaults over a wall. They narrowly miss the ostrich, which bucks up. Dense fog blankets the barn. As he loads, the monkey scrambles into the watchtower. Carpenter strolls through the fog. The monkey drops down inside the tower. Lucy sits awkwardly next to the sober Hemingway. The fog lifts, revealing a small barn. Hemingway stands. Carpenter, cloaked in fog, strolls past a sleeping chicken. Lucy, mouth open, gets out of the canoe. She strides cheerfully towards the barn, as Carpenter approaches a crackling bonfire. He inspects it curiously and glances around. The monkey stretches out his toes. A musician is lying on the bench. As she enters the barn, children hold out baskets of steaming rocks. The monkey stands gracefully. Lucy strides past members of the crew and spots her son, napping on a chair. She sways in surprise. He's got a bruise on the top of his head. His eyes blink sleepily. She glances at the Japanese woman and extends a hand to close Dennis's eyes, but a dolphin's fin does it for her. She regards the dolphin, her paw poised near Dennis's face. Members of the audience linger in the shadows of the barn. The barn is engulfed in a storm of mist and fog, a tiny drizzle but massive in the narrow alley.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A man smiles apologetically while handing a silk item and water to men on a truck. He holds his dog, glancing at Sarah, who peers anxiously out the window at a kangaroo paw and blood on the windscreen. Hunters relax on the truck as it travels through the desert and across a river. At night, Drover washes under a bucket's water, catching Sarah's attention. She retreats into her tent as Drover approaches suggestively. Meanwhile, camels pull an engine-less truck, and a man falls off, later ending up beside a horrified Sarah. They drive across a plain, encountering a girl and a boy on horseback at Faraway Downs. The boy narrowly avoids the truck, then climbs into a water tower amid smoke. Sarah sits next to a drunken Kipling as smoke clears to reveal a large house. Kipling collapses; Drover walks past a dead cow towards a funeral fire. Sarah, angry, heads to the house filled with smoking leaves, discovering her husband dead with a chest wound. Shocked, she reaches to close his eyes, but another man does it, as staff linger in the smoky room.
